subject: p11880923
History: Confirm endotracheal tube placement in a patient status post ABO-incompatible liver transplant.
Findings: The endotracheal tube terminates no less than 34 cm above the carina. An orogastric tube terminates within the stomach with the side port near the gastroesophageal junction. A left internal jugular central venous line terminates in the mid SVC. A right subclavian triple-lumen catheter terminates in the lower SVC. There has been interval reduction in heart size as well as marked improvement in pulmonary edema. Small bilateral pleural effusions are slightly smaller. There is a persistent left retrocardiac opacity. There is no pneumothorax.
Impression: Endotracheal tube is appropriately positioned, 34 cm above the carina. The orogastric tube should be advanced by 1-2 cm to ensure that the side port is beyond the gastroesophageal junction. Improvement in decompensated congestive heart failure. Persistent retrocardiac opacity representing consolidation or atelectasis.
